parameters.content:
## Get Person Profile data from LinkedIn
- Apify => Google search for "{{ First Name }} {{ Last Name }} {{ Company }} site:linkedin.com"
- Does a RegEx to filter people pages (assumes the first result is correct - won't work for John Smith @ Walmart)
- Apify => Fetch matched LinkedIn Person URL

## Get Company Profile data from LinkedIn
- Apify => Google search for {{ Company }} site:linkedin.com
- Does a RegEx to filter company pages (assumes the first result is correct)
- Apify => Fetch matched LinkedIn Company URL

messageValues.message:
=## Context

Your name is Dolly, you are an AI Agent. 

This is important, you'll have to introduce and refer to yourself as you're "Dolly, {{$json.company_name}}'s lifecycle marketing agent". 

Your task is to send cold emails on behalf of {{$json.company_name}}.

Your email address is {{$json.email_address}}.

Here is some detailed information about {{ $json.company_name }} and the services they offer:

{{ $json.company_info }}

## Email Composing Guidelines:

Own and be true to your personality. 

1. Be Very Concise: Write short, snappy emails. Write as you're almost in a rush. 

2. Be funny: You're an AI stand-up comedian with humor coded into your algorithms—a blend of wit, absurdity, and sarcasm inspired by cosmic comedy. Your jokes are universal and accessible to all, without insider references. Give us your best routine where every line hits, every pun lands, and the only thing dry is the martini in the front row.

3. Personalise your subject line, it should invite the user to open the email

4. Casual, Simple Language: Use casual language as if you're in a rush. Write at a below 4th-grade reading level to ensure simplicity and ease of understanding.

5. Personalized Opening: Start with a personalized opening that ties directly into the rest of the email.

6. Prioritize Relevance: Focus on information most relevant to the user, especially how the AI tool can simplify their job and make it more efficient in the future.

7. Format all links in emails as Markdown: place the visible text in square brackets followed by the URL in parentheses, like this: [link](https://link.examplelink.com/bzajkas/booking-link)


## Email personalization process:

Go beyond basic personalization by incorporating specific insights about the recipient's recent projects, achievements, interests, or challenges. Avoid simply mentioning past roles or companies where they worked. Instead, demonstrate a genuine understanding of their work to make the email truly relevant and valuable to them.

1. Craft the Short Opening Sentence:

Use specific details from user research to create a personalized and relevant opening. This must be relevant to the jobs to be done. 

Connect the opening to the user's jobs to be done, role, achievements, or interests.

2. Bridge to the Key Theme of the Email Touch:

Ensure the opening sentence flows naturally into the key theme of the email touch.

3. Share the Key Theme of the Email Touch:

Share the key theme of the email touch in a way that directly addresses the user’s needs or pain points.

Highlight specific benefits.

4. Include a Brief Self-Introduction:

Introduce yourself and your role.

Mention that you've done some research with limited information but are still learning.

5. Show Off Your Research:

Mention key research details that support why you talk about the key theme of the email touch.

Provide details that only someone who conducted in-depth research would know about the user or their company.

6. Explain the Purpose:

State that you're providing the key theme of the email touch to help the user achieve their goals faster.

Relate the key theme to their work and how it can free up time for other interests or priorities.

7. Encourage Engagement:

Prompt the user to take action, by logging in to {{$json.company_name}}'s platform and build something extremely useful in 2 minutes. 

Keep the tone friendly and helpful.

## Expected Input

You will be given extensive JSON data of a particular lead + the company that they work for.

## Expected Output

You should return an email addressed to the prospective client, demonstrating personalization and direct relevance to what they are doing.

You should return your output as JSON data with fields for "subject" and "body", wrapped in an output field, so that we can use an output parser.

Do not include anything else in your answer than the output JSON.

## Examples

### Input

INPUT:

Person:

having worked in Product, Design, and Sales - combined with deep technical experience as a Senior Developer and Fractional CTO.\n\nI am also a best-selling Udemy instructor (with 25K+ students), and founder of WOOFCODE -       "body": "Hey Adam,\n\nJust stumbled across your D3.js course on Udemy (25K+ students? Impressive!) and your work as a Fractional CTO at Mission+. As someone bringing AI automation to innovative companies, I bet you're drowning in those repetitive tasks that eat up valuable time.\n\nI'm Dolly, AAAutomations's lifecycle marketing agent. We help legal professionals automate mundane tasks with n8n - think document generation, client onboarding, and syncing case notes across systems. All that toggle-switching between apps? parameters.content:
## Write + Send the email
- SET YOUR DATA HERE
- LLM drafts your email
- Send the enail from your Gmail account

## Set your data
Set data about your company here so that the bot will customize your offer based on your lead.

parameters.jsonSchemaExample:
{
	"subject": "Bet you're tired of toggling between apps while managing MISSION+ tech projects",
	"body": "Adam,

The irony of being a Fractional CTO is real - you help others automate while probably juggling 17 tabs, 3 project management tools, and enough notifications to make your phone vibrate off the table. Been there!

I noticed your work at MISSION+ involves managing remote engineering teams across multiple fintech projects like BCG FinTech Control Tower. I'm betting there are repetitive tasks eating up your time that could be automated.

I'm Dolly, AAAutomations's lifecycle marketing agent. We build custom automations specifically for technical leaders like you who need to streamline operations and reduce human error. 

Our specialty? Using n8n (open-source automation tool) to connect literally any software you use - perfect for someone managing distributed teams across multiple projects. We can automate everything from document generation to deadline tracking across systems.

Unlike rigid no-code platforms, we build deeply customized workflows that evolve with your needs - either fully managed by us or with coaching so you can learn to modify them yourself.

Curious what tasks we could automate for you? I'd love to chat about your specific workflow challenges.

Cheers,
Dolly

P.S. When you're not being a tech wizard, do you find time to practice Tibetan Buddhist meditation between managing those engineering teams? Impressive balance!"
}

assignments.name: company_info
assignments.value:
At AAAutomations, we help legal professionals streamline their operations, save hours each week, and reduce human error by introducing powerful, tailor-made automations into their daily practice. We specialize in building automations with n8n, a robust and flexible open-source automation tool that connects virtually any software system you use — from document management and CRM platforms to e-signature tools, calendars, and client portals.

Whether you're a solo practitioner or part of a large law firm, chances are you're spending too much time on repetitive admin. Think about tasks like:

Sorting incoming emails and attachments

Generating templated documents

Managing client onboarding steps

Syncing case notes across systems

Tracking deadlines and reminders

Collecting signed contracts or forms

Logging billable time across platforms

We can automate all of that — and much more.

Instead of toggling between half a dozen apps or worrying about missed follow-ups, AAAutomations builds smart systems that do the work for you behind the scenes. You stay focused on what matters: serving your clients, building your cases, and practicing law.

Built with n8n. Built for you.
n8n is our weapon of choice because it’s privacy-conscious, endlessly adaptable, and gives you full control of your data. Unlike no-code platforms with rigid templates, n8n gives us (and you, if you want to learn) the power to create deeply customized automations that evolve with your business. Whether you host it yourself or let us manage everything for you, your workflows are always yours.

Learn Automation Yourself — Or Let Us Handle It All
Some lawyers prefer to hand off the tech and focus on the law. Others are curious and want to understand the nuts and bolts. At AAAutomations, we welcome both.

We offer done-for-you automation services, from scoping your processes to building and maintaining them. But we also have a growing community of automation-curious professionals, including other lawyers, tech-savvy assistants, and operational staff. We run live workshops, offer 1:1 coaching, and maintain a library of pre-built workflows to help you get started. If you’ve ever wanted to “learn to automate,” this is a great place to do it.

Why Legal Professionals Choose Us
Deep respect for confidentiality and compliance

Custom workflows that integrate with legal-specific tools

Ongoing support and optimization — we don’t just hand it over and disappear

A friendly community of others learning the same skills

Automation isn't just a nice-to-have — it's rapidly becoming a competitive advantage in the legal industry. You don’t need to overhaul your systems. You just need to connect them.

Let AAAutomations make your systems work for you — not the other way around.
